snippet: The two main suspects, believed to be members of an organized crime syndicate, were caught across the border in mainland China.
abstract: Hong Kong police claim a breakthrough in the investigation of a brutal attack on prominent newspaper editor Kevin Lau Chun-to, which sent chills through the territory's journalists; two men suspected of carrying out the attack were caught in mainland China and seven possible accomplices were arrested in Hong Kong.

byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and ALAN WONG

lead_paragraph: The two main suspects, believed to be members of an organized crime syndicate, were caught across the border in mainland China.

headline.main: 9 Suspects Arrested in Attack on Hong Kong Journalist
headline.print_headline: China: Arrests in Assault on an Editor
